artist: Artist: Attributed to Gerrit van Honthorst; Artist: after Alessandro Turchi (called Orbetto)
description: mounted on ivory sheet with pale red borders; seated man at left; seated woman at right; four standing figures in background; curtain at right; heavy shadow across center bottom; putto in LLC
medium: Red and white chalk on laid paper
provenance: John Skippe (1741-1812), Bredon Hill, Worcestershire (until d. 1812); by descent to his sister, Penelope Skippe Martin, by descent to Edward Holland (until d. 1916); his sister, Mrs. Rayner-Wood, Old Colwall, Malvern, Herefordshire (life interest); her nephew, Edward Holland Martin (until 1958; sale, The Skippe Collection, Christie's, November 20-21, 1958, no. 211b, as by Pietro Testa). Sale, Sotheby's, London, October 28, 1969, no. 47,  as Italian school, late 17th century. [Mia Weiner, New York; until 1985; sold February 14, as Attributed to Giulio Carpioni, for $1,500, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1985-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Hercules and Omphale
